title: Brexit will have to wait, but Drexit is happening as Mario Draghi bows out from the ECB
text:
Bumblebees, glitterbombs and "whatever it takes": Thursday's final policy meeting brings down the curtain on an eventful eight years for outgoing European Central Bank president Mario Draghi, that all began with the simple task of saving the euro.

With the UK's exit from the EU likely to be delayed again, Drexit is definitely happening this Halloween even if Brexit is not.

Draghi's stint has seen him lauded as "Super Mario" for saving the currency bloc – and lampooned as the "Count Draghila" who sucked savers dry with negative rates. Here are the four best, worst and maddest moments from the Italian.

Everybody remembers Draghi's "whatever it takes" promise to calm the eurozone...
